I agree Skip to content Mahdi Nasrullah Al-Ameen School of Computing Associate Professor Contact InformationOffice Location: SER 301JPhone: 435-797-0241Email: mahdi.al-ameen@usu.eduAdditional Information: Website Emphasis Human Factors in Privacy and Security, Human-computer Interaction, Human-centered Design, Information and Communications Technology for Development (ICT4D). Biography Mahdi Nasrullah Al-Ameen obtained PhD in School of Computing from the University of Texas at Arlington, winning “Outstanding Doctoral Dissertation Award” for his research on the impact of memory cues and user interaction on the usability of secure graphical passwords. Prior to joining USU, Dr. Al-Ameen worked as a Research Scientist at Rochester Institute of Technology, and a Post-doctoral Fellow and Assistant Director of Humans and Technology Laboratory at Clemson University.Dr. Al-Ameen was awarded the USU School of Computing Faculty Researcher of the Year 2020. He directs an interdisciplinary research group at PIXEL. His research is supported by the National Science Foundations (NSF).
